question:
What does this code segment print?
static void increment(int index) {
 index++;
}

public static void main(String[] args){
 int i = 0;
 increment(i);
 i++;
 System.out.println(i);
}
What class can use a method from another class without a visibility modifier?
correct_answer: Any class from the same package
incorrect_answers: Any class
Any class that extends this class
Any class from any subpackage of this package

question: What is an unchecked exception?
correct_answer: An exception that extends RuntimeException of Error that you do not need to catch or rethrow
incorrect_answers: An exception that extends RuntimeException that you may catch but cannot rethrow
An exception that can be of any type, and that you do not need to catch or rethrow
An exception that extends RuntimeException that you cannot catch but can rethrow

question: How can you add a method to an existing interface without having to modify the classes that already implement it?
correct_answer: You make this method a default method
incorrect_answers: You provide an implementation of this method in a separate static class
You make this method an abstract class
You cannot add a method to an interface without implementing in the existing implementing classes

question: What does a class need to do when it declares that it is implementing an interface?
correct_answer: It must be declared as abstract OR implement each of the interface's abstract methods, apart from the methods of the Object class.
incorrect_answers: It must implement each of the interface's abstract methods and override the default methods
It must be declared as abstract
It must implement each of the interface's abstract methods

question:
What will be the output of the following program?

public class MyFirst {

   public static void main(String[] args) {

      MyFirst obj =newMyFirst(n);

   }


   static int a = 10;

   static int n;

   int b = 5;

   int c;


   public MyFirst(int m) {

     System.out.println(a + ", " + b + ", " + c + ", " + n + ", "+m);

   }


   // Instance Block

   {

      b= 30;

      n = 20;

   }

   // Static Block

   static {

      a = 60;

   }

}
Which of the following option leads to the portability and security of Java?
correct_answer: Bytecode is executed by JVM
incorrect_answers: The applet makes the Java code secure and portable
Use of exception handling
Dynamic binding between objects

question: What is the return type of the hashCode() method in the Object class?
correct_answer: int
incorrect_answers: Object
long
void

question: What does the expression float a = 35 / 0 return?
correct_answer: Infinity
incorrect_answers: Not a Number
Run time exception

question:
Evaluate the following Java expression, if x=3, y=5, and z=10:
++z + y - y + z + x++

What will be the output of the following program?

public class Test {  

public static void main(String[] args) {  

    int count = 1;  

    while (count <= 15) {  

    System.out.println(count % 2 == 1 ?"***": "+++++");  

    ++count;  

        }

    }

 }
correct_answer: 8 times *** and 7 times +++++
incorrect_answers: 15 times ***
15 times +++++
Both will print only once

question: Which of the following for loop declaration is not valid?
correct_answer: for ( int i = 99; i >= 0; i / 9 )
incorrect_answers: for ( int i = 7; i <= 77; i += 7 )
for ( int i = 20; i >= 2; - -i )
for ( int i = 2; i <= 20; i = 2* i )

question: Which of the following is true about the anonymous inner class?
correct_answer: It has no class name
incorrect_answers: It has only methods
Objects can't be created
It has a fixed class name

question: Which option is false about the final keyword?
correct_answer: A final class cannot extend other classes.
incorrect_answers: A final method cannot be overridden in its subclasses.
A final class cannot be extended.
A final method can be inherited.

question:
Given that Student is a class, how many reference variables and objects are created by the following code?

Student studentName, studentId;

studentName = new Student();

Student stud_class = new Student();
correct_answer: Three reference variables and two objects are created.
incorrect_answers: Two reference variables and two objects are created.
One reference variable and two objects are created.
Three reference variables and three objects are created.

question: Which of the following is a valid syntax to synchronize the HashMap?
correct_answer: Map m1 = Collections.synchronizedMap(hashMap);
incorrect_answers: Map m = hashMap.synchronizeMap();
HashMap map =hashMap.synchronizeMap();
Map m2 = Collection.synchronizeMap(hashMap);

question:
Given that strings is an ArrayList with the following elements: "one", "two" and "three", what does the following code do?

for (string s : strings){

    System.out.println("s = " + s);

    strings.remove("two");

}
correct_answer: The code throws a ConcurrentModificationException
incorrect_answers: The code throws a ArrayOutModificationException
The code prints "one" and then "three"
The code throws an IllegalStateException

question:
You have the following code

try (Reader reader1 = new FileReader("log.txt");

  Reader reader2 = new FileReader("log.txt")){

  // some code

} catch (IOException e){

}

At run time, the constructor of reader2 throws an IOException, and the close() method of reader1 also throws an IOException. What exception(s) is/are caught in this code ?
correct_answer: The exception thrown by the construction of reader2
incorrect_answers: The exception thrown by the closing of reader1
A third exception is caught, wrapping the two first exceptions
Both exceptions are caught

question: You need to concatenate a list of instances of String together. What precautions should you take ?
correct_answer: Avoid the unnecessary creation of instances of String
incorrect_answers: Properly flush the buffer of string in the returned String
Properly flush the buffer of strings
Make sure all the elements of the list are properly consumed

question: You need to distribute your application as a JAR file on the internet. How can you make your customer sure that the JAR they will download has not been modified by anyone?
correct_answer: You can sign it so that the JVM can check for its integrity
incorrect_answers: You can distribute a password along with it
You can distribute a hash code along with it
You can hash each class in it

question:
What will be the output of the following program?

public class MyFirst {

    public static void main(String[] args) {

        System.out.println("main");

        MyFirst obj = new MyFirst(n);

    }

   public MyFirst(int m) {

        System.out.println("constructor");

   }

    {

       System.out.println("instance");

    }

    static {

       System.out.println("static");

    }

}
correct_answer: static -> main -> instance -> constructor
incorrect_answers: main -> constructor -> static -> instance
main -> static -> constructor -> instance
static -> instance -> main -> constructor

question:
The following code is a part of a Java program 

String a = "Hello";

String b = " World";

a.concat(b);

How many instances of String are created at the end of the program?

You need to call a method that throws IOException and FileNotFoundException. Knowing that FileNotFoundException is an extension of IOException, among the following catch clauses, which one is NOT correct?
correct_answer: catch(FileNotFoundException e){}catch(IOException e){}
incorrect_answers: catch(FileNotFoundException | IOException e){}
catch(Exception e){}
catch(IOException e){}

question:
The maximum value you can store in an int is 2147483647. What does the following code print out?

public static void main(String[] args){

  int max = 2147483647;

 System.out.println(max+1);

}
incorrect_answers: It throws an OperationOverflowException

question: Which functional interface does not return a value?
correct_answer: Consumer
incorrect_answers: Unary operator
Supplier
Predicate

question: Why are Java streams considered lazy?
correct_answer: Because intermediate operations are not evaluated until the terminal operation is invoked
incorrect_answers: Because, when the terminal operation is called, traversal of streams begins and the associated function is performed one by one
Because intermediate operations are evaluated before the terminal operation is invoked
Because, when the intermediate operation is called, traversal of streams begins and the associated function is performed one by one

question: You have a stream of strings of characters. You want to concatenate all those strings using a comma as a separator. How do you proceed?
correct_answer: Collect the elements using the Collectors.joining() collector, passing the comma as a parameter.
incorrect_answers: Collect the elements in a StringJoiner and call join() on that object, passing the comma as a parameter.
Reduce the stream in a StringBuilder, using the StringBuilder::add as the reduction function.
Collect the elements in a list and call join() on that list, passing the comma as a parameter.

question: What does it mean for a field to be final?
correct_answer: Its value must be set during the construction of the object and cannot be modified.
incorrect_answers: The field cannot be overridden in any extension this class may have.
Once set, its value can only be modified within the instance initializer block.
The field is a constant, accessible from all the class instances.
